CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. 2 reads: "Polio Clinic Successful - The L'Egants' Polio Clinic, held at Hill City recently, was very successful. Dr. Irsael Feldman was the physician in charge.  Nurses, representing the Central Health District, were Miss Lillie M. Lesense, Mrs. M. Smith and Miss Mary James from the County Health Department.  Staff members from Hill City and the Friendly Service Bureau assisted.  In the left photo are L'Egants Club members, seated, left to right: Mrs. Carrie Washington, Jean Bolden, Vivian Swain, and Mrs. Barbara Sowell. Standing: Mrs. Nancy Sanford, Ann Perkins, Lee Brun [LeeBrun] Johnson and Mrs. Joanne Jamison...-Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: L'Egants Club members, seated from left: Carrie Washington, Jean Bolden, Vivian Swain, Barbara Sowell; standing: Nancy Sanford, Ann Perkins, LeeBrun Johnson, and Joanne Jamison, gathered in interior with man, woman, and girl, for Polio Clinic, Hill City, Hill District
